page.title: 10HOME LIFE (CONTINUED)
page.content: {BROOK COTTAGES}WERE BUILT 100YRS AGO AS FARM WORKERS COTTAGES BELONGING TO {OAKS}FARM.THEY WERE NOT NAMED BROOK COTTAGES UNTIL THEY WERE RENOVATED IN 1971. IN WINTER THEY OFTEN GET SNOWED IN AND THEY OFTEN CANNOT TRAVEL DOWN THE LANE (WEST) TOWARDS WARWICK AS THE FORD NEAR THE COTTAGES IS FLOODED. THE WATER SUPPLY TO THE COTTAGES IS NOT VERY EFFICIENT. THERE WAS NO WATER SUPPLY UNTIL 1945, UNTIL THEN THE FARMER USED TO DELIVER IT. THE BARRATTS HAVE NO PETS BUT THEY OWN ONE THIRD OF AN ACRE OF LAND AND HAVE RABBITS AND FOXES VISITING THEIR GARDEN. THE FAMILY IN NO.1,OWN OVER TWO ACRES OF LAND AND HAVE 1 DOG, 15 CHICKENS AND 20 SHEEP. THEY ALSO HAVE A TRACTOR AND A PLOUGH.
